Class Shape

java.lang.Object
Shape
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Shape>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConvexPolygon, Ellipse
public abstract class Shape extends Object implements Comparable<Shape>
Abstract definition of a shape, which has a Color attribute and a boolean attribute for indicating whether ths shape is filled (true) or wireframed (false). attribute

  • Constructor Summary

    Abstract constructor for Shape objects; constructs Color and isFilled property.

      isFilled - true if filled, false if only wireframe

      Moves this Shape by the x and y amounts specified (in the Point delta).

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Shape anotherShape)
      Compares two shapes first (1) lexicographically and then (2) by their area.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Shape>
      Parameters:
      anotherShape - the Shape to be compared
      Returns:
      0, negative, or a positive integer according to the following rules:

      exactly 0: if the argument Shape's class name equals this Shape's and the areas of the two Shapes differ less than by the EPSILON value of 0.0001;

      a value less than 0: if this class name is less than the argument Shape's class name, or if the class names match but this Shape's area is less than the argument Shape's area.

      a value greater than 0: when this class name is greater than the argument Shape's class name, or if the class names match but this Shape's area is greater than the argument Shape's area.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Compares this Shape to the specified object.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The object to compare this Shape against
      Returns:
      true if the given object represents a Shape equivalent to this Shape, false otherwise
